newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombian peso dips in "lazy" trade.
newsitem.headline: Colombian peso dips in "lazy" trade.

text.p: BOGOTA, April 28 Reuter - Colombia's peso dipped 0.35 to 1,063.95 against the dollar in a "lazy" session Monday, interbank traders said.
"The market was very lazy today. Everybody was trying to keep the exchange rate steady so as not to show any month end losses," one Bogota dealer said.
The peso rose to an intraday high of 1.062.45 in early trading as petrodollars were ploughed back into the market, but later sank to an intraday low of 1,065.5 pesos.
Dealers reported 320 trades worth a total $127 million, below the daily average of about $180 million.
